intro: Diodia tetragona, commonly known as four-angled diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its square stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Diodia tetragona is typically found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
